qas.question: How many evolutionary origins do short distance passerine migrants have?
Which species have long-distance migrants in the same family?
Why have some specied progressively shortened their return migration?

answers.text: to stay in the northern hemisphere

context: Short-distance passerine migrants have <a0_0>two<a0_0/> evolutionary origins. Those that have long-distance migrants in the same family, such as <a1_0>the common chiffchaff Phylloscopus collybita<a1_0/>, are species of southern hemisphere origins that have progressively shortened their return migration <a2_0>to stay in the northern hemisphere<a2_0/>.
